New Records: Gerhard Erasmus struck his 11th fifty-plus T20I score
Gerhard Erasmus passed JJ Smit's record of 51 T20I sixes for Namibia
Key Match Events: A 74-run partnership between Richie Berrington and Michael Leask saw Scotland home
Gerhard Erasmus' decision to win the toss and bat first was not immediately vindicated as Namibia found themselves 55 for 4
Erasmus' wily offspinners and Bernard Scholtz's slow left-arm saw Scotland fall from 49 for 1 to 73 for 4 after 11 overs
Post-Match Reflections: Gerhard Erasmus was stumped one ball after reaching his fifty
Erasmus all-round display in vain as he said 'it would be better if had come in a win'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Scotland produced a stunning run chase to beat Namibia by five wickets in the T20 World Cup 2024
Brad Currie put in a display that showed there is glory to be had with mediums
Leask's final six was his biggest of the lot - reading a slower ball from Ruben Trumpelmann and sending it back with interest over to the leg side for all of 101 meters
Others: The match was played at the Kensington Oval, Bridgetown, on June 06, 2024
Scotland secured their first T20I victory over Namibia at the fourth attempt
